result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome N Addison Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence; STRAIGHT TIME

miscConds.notes: Submit a DNA sample by and pay the surcharge during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

- No possession of any dangerous weapons/firearms unless it is part of a Firearms Safety/CCW Course.
- No possession or use of any illegal drugs.

- Complete a CCW Course.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: With credit for 2 days time served; STAYED; to be used at the Agent's discretion

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerome N Addison Sr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jerome N Addison Sr in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Jerome N Addison Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
AS TO COUNT 2: 
Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Sentencing proceeded. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, STRAIGHT TIME. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Serve 30 days condition time, with credit for 2 days time served, Court STAYED the condition time to be used at the Agents discretion
- No possession of any dangerous weapons/firearms unless it is part of a firearms safety/CCW course
- Complete a CCW course
- maintain absolute sobriety 
- no possession or use of any illegal drugs

- Submit a DNA sample by and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, filed.

Defendant Jerome N Addison in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jerome N Addison appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense counsel has received discovery and has not received an offer and requests additional time to review and a plea/sentencing hearing date.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 054539,
Payable Number: 1012467,
Receipt Number: 22RP023513,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Jerome N Addison in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jerome N Addison appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defense counsel informed the Court that no discovery or offer has been received.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jerome N Addison in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 37.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/19/2022@1:00pm
